definitions: irregular patch or spot of color, stain, or blemish on a surface
examples: There were dark blotches of ink all over the paper
The disease left red blotches on her skin that lasted for weeks

definitions: loose-fitting upper garment worn by women and girls, typically with buttons
examples: She wore a white silk blouse to the job interview
The school uniform requires a navy blue blouse for all female students

definitions: unintended negative consequences of an action, especially in politics or foreign policy
examples: The military intervention resulted in significant blowback from neighboring countries
The company faced blowback from customers after announcing the price increase

definitions: mechanical device that produces a strong current of air
informal term for telephone, especially in British English
examples: The leaf blower made quick work of clearing the driveway
He used an industrial blower to dry the freshly painted walls
Give me a call on the blower when you get home
She picked up the blower and dialed his number immediately

definitions: fish that inflates its body with water or air when threatened, many species containing deadly toxin
examples: The blowfish puffed up to twice its normal size when approached
Japanese chefs require special licenses to prepare blowfish for consumption

definitions: action or sound of wind or air moving with force in a particular direction
examples: The constant blowing of the wind made it hard to hear
The blowing of leaves across the yard signaled autumn's arrival

definitions: sudden bursting or rupture of a tire while driving
overwhelming defeat or victory in a game or competition
professional hair styling that involves blow-drying for smoothness and volume
examples: The truck had a dangerous blowout on the highway at high speed
We had to call roadside assistance after the blowout damaged our rim
The game turned into a blowout with the home team winning 45-7
Everyone left early once it became clear the match was a blowout
She gets a blowout at the salon before every important event
The stylist gave her a beautiful blowout that lasted for days

definitions: thick layer of fat under the skin of whales and other marine mammals
examples: Whale blubber helps insulate the animals in cold ocean waters
Historically, blubber was rendered into oil for lamps and heating

definitions: woodland flower with drooping blue bell-shaped blooms that flowers in spring
examples: The forest floor was carpeted with bluebells in early May
Wild bluebells are protected by law in some countries

definitions: small round blue or purple berry that grows on bushes in clusters
examples: She added fresh blueberries to her morning pancakes
Wild blueberries are smaller but more flavorful than cultivated ones

definitions: small North American songbird with bright blue plumage, symbol of happiness
examples: A pair of bluebirds nested in the birdhouse we installed
The eastern bluebird is the state bird of Missouri and New York

definitions: blue wildflower native to Texas, growing in clusters and state flower of Texas
examples: Fields of bluebonnets attract thousands of tourists to Texas each spring
It's illegal to pick bluebonnets on public property in Texas

definitions: large species of tuna highly prized for sushi and sashimi, endangered from overfishing
examples: A single bluefin tuna can sell for hundreds of thousands of dollars
Bluefin populations have declined dramatically due to commercial fishing

definitions: aggressive saltwater fish with blue-green coloring found along Atlantic coast
examples: Bluefish are known for their sharp teeth and voracious feeding habits
We caught several bluefish during our deep-sea fishing trip

definitions: technical drawing printed with white lines on blue background showing building plans
detailed plan or scheme for achieving something or guiding future action
examples: The architect spread out the blueprints on the conference table
Original blueprints were actually blue due to the chemical process used
The business plan serves as a blueprint for the company's growth
They created a blueprint for educational reform in the district

definitions: steep cliff or bank, especially beside water or river
attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something
examples: The house was built on a bluff overlooking the Mississippi River
Eagles nested in the rocky bluff above the shoreline
His threat to quit was just a bluff to get a raise
She called his bluff and he had to back down

definitions: stupid or careless mistake that causes problems or embarrassment
examples: The CEO's public blunder damaged the company's reputation significantly
It was a tactical blunder to reveal our strategy so early

definitions: something that cannot be seen clearly or is out of focus
state of confusion where things are unclear or run together
examples: The photo was just a blur because the camera moved
Without my glasses, everything is a complete blur
The last few weeks have been a blur of activity and stress
The line between work and home has become a blur lately

definitions: short promotional description of a book, movie, or product, typically on the back cover
examples: The blurb on the book jacket made it sound like a thriller
Publishers spend considerable time crafting the perfect blurb for new releases

definitions: reddening of the face caused by embarrassment, shame, or modesty
cosmetic powder applied to cheeks to add color
examples: A deep blush spread across her cheeks when he complimented her
His blush gave away that he was lying about the surprise
She applied a light pink blush to give her face a healthy glow
The makeup artist recommended a peach blush for her skin tone

definitions: large snake that kills prey by constriction, found in tropical regions
long scarf made of feathers or fur worn around the neck
examples: The boa constrictor can grow up to thirteen feet in length
Boas are popular as pets despite their impressive size
She wore a pink feather boa with her costume to the party
The vintage boa complemented her 1920s flapper dress perfectly

definitions: uncastrated male pig or wild ancestor of domestic pigs with tusks
examples: The wild boar charged through the underbrush with surprising speed
Boar hunting has been a tradition in Europe for centuries

definitions: person who pays to live and have meals in someone else's house
student who lives at school during term time
examples: They took in a boarder to help with the mortgage payments
The elderly widow had three boarders living in her large house
As a boarder, she only went home during school holidays
The boarding school had over 200 boarders from various countries

definitions: arrangement where meals and lodging are provided for payment
process of getting on a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle
examples: The boarding at the inn included three meals a day
She found boarding with a local family near the university
Boarding for flight 447 will begin at gate 23 shortly
The boarding process was delayed due to a security issue

definitions: room where a board of directors meets to conduct business
examples: The merger was discussed in the boardroom for over six hours
She earned her place in the corporate boardroom through hard work

definitions: raised wooden walkway built along a beach or waterfront for pedestrians
examples: The Atlantic City boardwalk stretches for over four miles
Street performers entertained tourists strolling along the boardwalk

definitions: statement expressing excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements
examples: His boast about being the best player proved to be premature
She couldn't help but make a small boast about her promotion

definitions: act of talking with excessive pride about one's achievements or possessions
examples: His constant boasting about his wealth annoyed his colleagues
There's a fine line between confidence and boasting

definitions: building beside water used for storing boats and related equipment
examples: They converted the old boathouse into a charming vacation rental
The rowing team stores all their shells in the university boathouse

definitions: activity of traveling in or operating boats for pleasure or sport
examples: Weekend boating on the lake is our family's favorite summer activity
The marina offers boating lessons for beginners every Saturday morning

definitions: person who operates or is employed on a boat, especially for hire
examples: The boatman expertly navigated the narrow canals of Venice
Local boatmen ferry tourists across the river for a small fee

definitions: ship's officer in charge of equipment, crew, and deck operations
examples: The boatswain blew his whistle to signal the change of watch
As boatswain, he was responsible for maintaining all the ship's rigging

definitions: place where boats are built, repaired, or stored out of water
examples: The old fishing vessel was hauled up at the boatyard for repairs
The boatyard employs skilled craftsmen who specialize in wooden boats

definitions: women's hairstyle cut short and even all around at about jaw level
quick up and down movement, especially of the head
examples: She decided to get a stylish bob for the summer months
The classic bob haircut never really goes out of fashion
The cork created a gentle bob on the water's surface
He gave a quick bob of his head to acknowledge her

definitions: cylinder or spindle on which thread, yarn, or wire is wound
examples: The sewing machine bobbin ran out of thread halfway through the seam
She organized her bobbins by color in the sewing box

definitions: small ball of fabric used as decoration, especially on hats
mistake in handling something, especially dropping or fumbling
examples: The winter hat had a large red bobble on top
She sewed bobbles along the edge of the cushion cover
The quarterback's bobble cost them the game in overtime
It was just a small bobble in an otherwise perfect performance

definitions: informal British term for police officer, named after Robert Peel
examples: The bobby on the corner gave directions to lost tourists
Traditional bobbies patrolled the streets without carrying firearms

definitions: medium-sized wild cat native to North America with spotted coat and short tail
examples: A bobcat was spotted hunting rabbits near the golf course
Bobcats are excellent climbers and often rest in trees

definitions: sled designed for racing down ice tracks with teams of two or four
examples: The Olympic bobsled team practiced their starts every morning
Modern bobsleds can reach speeds over 90 miles per hour

definitions: British term for bobsled used in winter sport racing on ice tracks
examples: The bobsleigh competition was the highlight of the Winter Olympics
Each bobsleigh is precisely engineered for maximum speed and safety

definitions: animal, especially horse or dog, with tail cut short or naturally short
examples: The old bobtail sheepdog herded the flock with remarkable skill
Some cats are born with a natural bobtail due to genetic mutation

definitions: strong dark German beer traditionally brewed in winter and consumed in spring
examples: He ordered a bock beer to go with his hearty German meal
The brewery releases their special bock every year in March

definitions: informal slang term for human body, especially when attractive or fit
examples: He's been working out and has quite an impressive bod now
Beach season had everyone worried about their summer bod

definitions: small grocery store, especially in Spanish-speaking neighborhoods, selling everyday items
examples: She stopped at the corner bodega for milk and bread
The bodega owner knew all the regular customers by name

definitions: close-fitting upper part of a woman's dress, or separate fitted vest
examples: The wedding dress featured an intricately beaded bodice
She laced up the bodice of her Renaissance festival costume

definitions: person who develops muscles through weight training and special diet for competition
examples: The professional bodybuilder spent six hours daily in the gym
Female bodybuilders have gained more recognition in recent years

definitions: sport or activity of developing muscles through weight training and nutrition
examples: Bodybuilding requires strict dedication to both training and diet
He took up bodybuilding to improve his health and confidence
